title: Audit Observability dashboards (4) - uncategorized
description:
Review 4 observability dashboards (most uncategorized):
- graylog-metrics (ID: 6787) - uncategorized
- mongodb-cluster-summary (custom) - uncategorized
- mongodb-instance-summary (custom) - uncategorized
- opensearch-exporter (ID: 14191) - uncategorized

Check: Are exporters deployed? Add proper category labels.

title: Audit Traefik dashboards (2) - potential duplicate
description:
Review 2 Traefik dashboards:
- traefik-services (ID: 12250)
- traefik-v2-alt (ID: 4475)

Check: Are both needed? Which is better? Consolidate to one.

title: Update lighthouse-userdata.sh for Traefik + cert-manager
description: Add Traefik and cert-manager deployment to cloud-init for future lighthouse instances.

title: Create Hubble UI IngressRoute for Traefik
description: Create IngressRoute to expose Hubble UI (Cilium's network flow visualization) via Traefik at hubble.talos00. Service is hubble-ui in kube-system namespace on port 80.
design: Create infrastructure/base/cilium/ingressroute.yaml with IngressRoute for hubble-ui service. Follow same pattern as monitoring ingressroutes.
acceptance_criteria:
- IngressRoute created and applied
- hubble.talos00 accessible in browser
- Update /etc/hosts if needed

title: Dual Ingress Architecture for Hybrid Cluster
description:
Add a second entry point into the hybrid cluster via AWS Traefik, complementing existing homelab Traefik. Enables direct access to AWS-hosted services without routing through Nebula mesh.

**Design Doc**: docs/hybrid-llm-cluster/DUAL-INGRESS.md

**Architecture**:
- Homelab: Traefik on *.talos00 (existing)
- AWS: Traefik on *.aws.yourdomain.com (new)
- Nebula: Unchanged (mesh connectivity for Liqo)

**Stack**: Traefik + Cloudflare DNS + cert-manager + Let's Encrypt

title: Configure Cloudflare DNS + proxy for AWS ingress
description: Add A record pointing to AWS EIP with orange cloud (proxy enabled). Configure SSL/TLS to Full (strict).

title: Deploy Traefik on AWS k3s
description: Install Traefik via Helm on AWS k3s cluster with hostPort binding (80/443). Create `infrastructure/overlays/aws-gpu/traefik/values.yaml`.

title: Update /etc/hosts with hubble.talos00 entry
description: Add hubble.talos00 to /etc/hosts pointing to cluster IP for Hubble UI access. This is manual step or update update-hosts.sh script.

title: [EPIC] Grafana Dashboard Audit & Cleanup
description:
Audit all 37 Grafana dashboards for:
- Duplicates/overlapping functionality  
- Missing data (broken queries, missing ServiceMonitors)
- Proper folder organization
- Category labels consistency

Current state: 37 dashboards, 10 uncategorized, multiple potential overlaps in kubernetes monitoring.

Proposed folder structure:
- Kubernetes (cluster, pods, volumes)
- Infrastructure (nodes, storage)
- Networking (Cilium, Traefik, Linkerd)
- Observability (Graylog, OpenSearch, MongoDB)
- Applications (Kasa, PostgreSQL)
- GitOps (ArgoCD, Flux)
- Hybrid Cluster (Liqo, AWS, LLM Scaler)
notes:
## Audit Complete

### Summary
- Total: 62 dashboards
- Working: 49 (79%)
- Broken: 5 (8%)
- No Data: 6 (10%)
- Duplicates: 2 (3%)

### DELETE:
1. Apache JMeter (InfluxDB)
2. K8S Dashboard (VictoriaMetrics)
3. Traefik 2.2 (broken datasource)
4. K8s PV duplicate

### FIX:
1. Cilium Flows - Hubble Observer (datasource mapping)

### WAIT:
- Cilium dashboards (4) - metrics will populate

### ADD SERVICEMONITOR:
- etcd, Graylog (if needed)

title: Audit Kasa dashboards (6) - custom, likely no data
description:
Review 6 Kasa custom dashboards (uncategorized):
- kasa-alerts-monitoring (custom)
- kasa-battery-sizing (custom)
- kasa-comparative-analytics (custom)
- kasa-forecasting-analytics (custom)
- kasa-real-time-monitoring (custom)
- kasa-tou-cost-optimization (custom)

Check: Is kasa-exporter deployed? Are these dashboards functional or stale?

title: Audit Infrastructure dashboards (2) - verify node-exporter
description:
Review 2 infrastructure dashboards:
- node-exporter-full (ID: 1860)
- postgresql-database (ID: 9628)

Check: Is node-exporter scraping all nodes? PostgreSQL exporter deployed?

title: Resume Flux GitOps after CNI migration
description: Flux is currently suspended for migration. Resume all kustomizations and verify reconciliation works correctly with new CNI.

title: Install cert-manager + Let's Encrypt on AWS k3s
description: Deploy cert-manager with Cloudflare DNS-01 solver. Create ClusterIssuer and Certificate for AWS ingress domain.

title: Provision Grafana dashboards for Cilium/Hubble via GrafanaDashboard CRD
description:
Create GrafanaDashboard CRDs to provision Cilium and Hubble dashboards into Grafana. Cilium provides official dashboards:
- Cilium Agent dashboard
- Cilium Operator dashboard
- Hubble dashboard (network flows, DNS, HTTP)

These should be provisioned as ConfigMaps or via GrafanaDashboard CRD (grafana-operator pattern used in this cluster).
design: Create infrastructure/base/monitoring/grafana-dashboards/cilium-dashboards.yaml with GrafanaDashboard CRDs. Source dashboards from Cilium GitHub repo or use dashboard JSON IDs. Follow pattern from existing dashboards like linkerd-dashboards.yaml.
acceptance_criteria:
- GrafanaDashboard CRDs created
- Dashboards appear in Grafana under Cilium folder
- Metrics visualized correctly (after ServiceMonitors deployed)

title: Audit Cilium dashboards (5) - verify metrics working
description:
Review 5 Cilium dashboards (newly added):
- cilium-agent (ID: 16611)
- cilium-operator (ID: 16612)
- cilium-hubble (ID: 16613)
- cilium-hubble-flows (ID: 23862)
- cilium-policy-verdicts (ID: 18015)

Check: Are PodMonitors scraping correctly? Do dashboards show data?

title: Consolidate dashboard categories and folder structure
description:
After audit, implement consistent folder structure:

1. Update all GrafanaDashboard CRDs with proper folder spec
2. Standardize category labels
3. Remove duplicates identified in audit
4. Document final dashboard inventory

Proposed folders:
- Kubernetes
- Networking (Cilium, Traefik, Linkerd)
- Observability (Graylog, OpenSearch, MongoDB)
- Applications (Kasa, PostgreSQL)
- Infrastructure (Nodes)
- GitOps (ArgoCD, Goldilocks)
- Hybrid Cluster (Liqo, AWS, LLM)

title: Deploy whoami test service on AWS ingress
description: Create test deployment with IngressRoute to validate Traefik + TLS stack. File: `infrastructure/overlays/aws-gpu/test-services/whoami.yaml`

title: Audit Linkerd dashboards (5) - check if linkerd-viz needed
description:
Review 5 Linkerd dashboards:
- linkerd-top-line (ID: 15474)
- linkerd-deployment (ID: 15475)
- linkerd-route (ID: 15481)
- linkerd-daemonset (ID: 15484)
- linkerd-service (ID: 14274)

Check: Do these require linkerd-viz extension? Are metrics being scraped?

title: Audit Kubernetes dashboards (6) - check for overlaps
description:
Review 6 Kubernetes dashboards for redundancy:
- k8s-cluster-monitoring (ID: 315)
- k8s-comprehensive (ID: 15661)
- k8s-monitoring-overview (ID: 14623)
- k8s-pods-view (ID: 15760)
- k8s-pvc (ID: 13646)
- k8s-volumes (ID: 11454)

Check: Are cluster-monitoring, comprehensive, and monitoring-overview duplicates? PVC vs volumes overlap?
notes: Starting comprehensive dashboard audit via Grafana API. Found 58 total dashboards across 4 locations (3 folders + General).

title: Add Ollama IngressRoute for AWS entry point
description: Create IngressRoute exposing Ollama LLM API via AWS Traefik. File: `infrastructure/overlays/aws-gpu/catalyst-llm/ingressroute.yaml`

title: Verify Linkerd service mesh works with Cilium
description: Linkerd is CNI-agnostic but verify mTLS and service mesh functionality after Cilium migration. Test scratch namespace services.

title: Audit GitOps/Misc dashboards (3)
description:
Review remaining dashboards:
- argocd-notifications (ID: 17267) - argocd category
- goldilocks-vpa (ID: 16516) - resource-optimization category
- resource-efficiency (custom) - optimization category
- pod-cleanup (custom) - uncategorized

Check: ArgoCD notifications configured? VPA recommendations working?

title: Switch Talos config to Cilium CNI (disable Flannel/kube-proxy)
description: Once Cilium is verified working: Update controlplane.yaml with cni.name: none and proxy.disabled: true. Apply config to nodes (will trigger rolling restart).

title: Update AWS security group for HTTP/HTTPS ingress
description: Add ports 80/443 to nebula-lighthouse security group. Create `scripts/hybrid-llm/update-sg-for-ingress.sh` for existing instances.

title: Verify Cilium pods healthy and networking functional
description: Before switching CNI, ensure Cilium agent pods are Running on all nodes and Hubble is operational. Test pod-to-pod connectivity.

title: Recover cluster after failed CNI migration
description: Control plane rebooted after config change that disabled kube-proxy before Cilium was installed. Config has been reverted to use Flannel + kube-proxy. Waiting for cluster recovery.

title: Create Cilium ServiceMonitors for Prometheus
description:
Create ServiceMonitors to scrape metrics from Cilium components:
- cilium-agent (port 9962) - core CNI metrics
- cilium-operator (port 9963) - operator metrics  
- cilium-envoy (port 9964) - proxy metrics
- hubble metrics if enabled

Current manifest has prometheus.io annotations but lacks explicit ServiceMonitors for kube-prometheus-stack.
design: Create infrastructure/base/monitoring/servicemonitors/cilium-servicemonitor.yaml with ServiceMonitors for each component. Reference kube-system namespace, use app.kubernetes.io/part-of: cilium selector labels.
acceptance_criteria:
- ServiceMonitors created in monitoring namespace
- Prometheus targets show cilium endpoints
- cilium_* and hubble_* metrics available in Prometheus

title: Audit Hybrid Cluster dashboards (4) - verify data sources
description:
Review 4 hybrid cluster dashboards:
- hybrid-cluster-overview (custom) - cluster-overview category
- liqo-overview (ID: 16098) - hybrid-cluster category
- llm-scaler (custom) - hybrid-cluster category
- aws-ec2-instances (ID: 6419) - hybrid-cluster category

Check: Is hybrid-cluster-exporter working? AWS metrics available?

title: Install Cilium alongside Flannel (parallel CNI)
description: Install Cilium while Flannel is still running. This allows Cilium to initialize and be ready before we switch CNI. Apply cilium-manifest.yaml to cluster.
